resources.string: "This feature encrypts and uploads your device's ID to Avast's servers (%s)."
The virus is an adware. It automatically renders advertisements.
The virus is a cryptor. It is a malicious software which is transmitted by means of replicating itself in storage space.
The virus is a dropper. It carries the code that installs other malicious viruses.
The virus is an exploit. It takes advantage of bugs or vulnerabilities in your system in order to cause unintended or unanticipated behavior.
The infection is inferred by using a specific heuristic. The specific heuristic analysis says that it is a virus.
The virus is a joke. It creates some annoying or humorous effects. It normally causes less damage than other viruses.
"The virus is a potentially unwanted program (PUP). It's a program that may be harmful (spyware, adware, etc.), despite the fact that users give consent to download it."

The virus is a rootkit. It is a type of software designed to hide the fact that an operating system has been compromised. It is used to gain control over the device by hiding deep inside the system. Rootkits allow viruses and malware to “hide in plain sight” by disguising as necessary files that normal antivirus software will overlook.
"The virus is a spyware. It is a software that covertly gathers user information through the user's Internet connection without his or her knowledge."
A common suspicious type. The antivirus system is trying to classify it.
The virus is a potentially evil tool similar to PUP.

"The virus is a trojan. It is a malware designed to provide unauthorized, remote access to a user's device. Trojans normally do not have the ability to replicate themselves like viruses. However, they can lead to other malware being installed on your device, data being stolen, or other malicious activities."

The virus is a worm. It is a standalone malware that replicates itself in order to spread to other devices. It takes advantage of files or information transfer features of your system (e.g., networks), it can travel without any human action. Worms almost always cause at least some harm to the network.
"This feature encrypts and uploads your device's ID to AVL's servers (%s)."
Upload and scan app names and details using online virus definitions.
"This feature encrypts and uploads your device's ID to Tencent's servers (%s)."
